New Jersey Democratic Governor Phil Murphy receives a chorus of boos from concert crowd when he's called to the stage just two miles from his waterfront mansion 
09/07/23 11:09
On stage in Monmouth County Saturday night, the governor was invited on stage by Brian Kirk and The Jirks, a local band, at the Red Rock Tap & Grill in Red Bank, just two miles from his waterfront mansion. Video showed Phil Murphy getting raucous boos from the crowd despite getting a kind welcome from the band. The singer eventually attempted to quiet those in attendance and call for civility. While Murphy was ostensibly on home turf, the area and Monmouth County as a whole is hostile territory for Democrats, as most of New Jersey is blue.
